intro: [WRONG START] Robinia viscosa f. Bella-rosea, commonly known as the rose-leaf false acacia, is a cultivar of the Robinia genus, characterized by its distinctive pinkish-rose foliage. This ornamental tree or shrub features compound leaves that are often a striking shade of pink or rose, providing visual interest throughout the growing season. It produces small, fragrant white flowers in spring, followed by long, flat pods that mature into a reddish-brown color. The plant is relatively drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental landscaping. Its unique foliage makes it a standout in gardens and public spaces.
